title: How to Make Syllabub

steps.headline: Dissolve the sugar in the wine or sherry.
Beat the cream until it has just started to thicken.
Add the lemon juice and dissolved sugar mixture to the cream.
steps.description: Continue to beat as you add the liquid slowly.

steps.headline: Continue to beat slowly.
steps.description: Add the lemon balm leaves and lemon rind.

steps.headline: Keep beating until the creamy mixture resembles whipped cream in consistency.
Transfer the mixture to a serving dish.
steps.description: A glass dish or similar is ideal. Place in the refrigerator to chill; syllabub should be well chilled for serving.

steps.headline: Serve.
steps.description: Garnish with lemon balm leaves and a sprinkle of the ground nutmeg. Supply a serving spoon for guests to help themselves with.

steps.headline: Pour the orange juice and Grand Marnier over the sugar in the mixing bowl.

steps.description: Whisk the ingredients together to form gentle peaks. Do not over beat.

steps.headline: Transfer the mixture to a serving dish.
steps.description: Layer it with the orange segments.

steps.headline: Garnish with toasted almonds.
steps.description: While optional, this makes for a tasty finish.

text: Lemon syllabub Dissolve the sugar in the wine or sherry.  Beat the cream until it has just started to thicken.  Add the lemon juice and dissolved sugar mixture to the cream. Continue to beat as you add the liquid slowly. Continue to beat slowly. Add the lemon balm leaves and lemon rind. Keep beating until the creamy mixture resembles whipped cream in consistency.  Transfer the mixture to a serving dish. A glass dish or similar is ideal. Place in the refrigerator to chill; syllabub should be well chilled for serving. Serve. Garnish with lemon balm leaves and a sprinkle of the ground nutmeg. Supply a serving spoon for guests to help themselves with. Orange syllabub Pour the orange juice and Grand Marnier over the sugar in the mixing bowl. Stir to dissolve the sugar. Add the cream. Whisk the ingredients together to form gentle peaks. Do not over beat. Transfer the mixture to a serving dish. Layer it with the orange segments. Garnish with toasted almonds. While optional, this makes for a tasty finish. Serve. Supply a serving spoon for guests to themselves with.
